column4: has anyone heard of a clicking noise being a problem with 9.10?
more info?
so, it's like a repeating clicking noise... kinda staticy. not hard drive, sounds like its coming from my laptop speakers inspite of others being plugged in  tc111 xt28
xt28 repeating, highly annoying. it may go away when i play music but then starts again when that stops.
is your 'mic' muted?
how do i do that?
i just installed 9.10 about an hour ago... it was a problem present even during install. fwiw.
click on speaker icon and choose 'volume control'
desktop, notebook, netbook? sound card chipset?
notebook hp pavillion dv6000 amd turion 64 x2. don't know about my sound card...
muted mic turned sound themes off no luck.
sound card chipset should be a crystal sound 4xxx, muting just the mic should disable other sounds... curious
what does 'sudo lspci -vnn | grep audio -i' return from a console?
how do i copy text using xchat?
thanks, tried to right click
sorry, don't use xchat...
00:10.1 Audio device [0403]: nVidia Corporation MCP51 High Definition Audio [10de:026c] (rev a2)
thanks ctmjr
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+bug/381721
is there a resolution to those problems? or are those just complaints with no resolution yet?
regression bug... status is currently 'new' and 'undecided'. be sure to click the 'does this bug affect you?' link so devs track the numbers
